Deploying To AWS¶

Step-by-Step Guide

NOTE: A premium tier account will be needed to deploy to AWS. Free tier servers do not have sufficient memory to run the classification functions.

  1. Login in to the AWS Management Console.

  2. Choose the ‘Launch a virtual machine’ option in the ‘Build a solution’ section.

  3. Select the Amazon Linux 2 AMI option.

  4. Choose the instance type you required (a minimum of 2 vCPUs and 8 GB of memory is recommended)

  5. Click Next: Configure Instance and keep all the defaults and click Next: Add Storage.

  6. Select how much storage you think you will need. If you have modified the script to save image to a database, be sure to factor this in.

  7. Click Next: Add Tags and then Next: Configure Security Group

  8. Add a custom TCP rule with the port range set to the port you will declare in the module config.json file. (Make a note of the port for later.)

  9. Set the CIDR, IP or Security Group field to 0.0.0.0/0

  10. Click review and then finish. Be sure to set up a private key and download it. This will be needed to log in to the virtual machine.

  11. Back at the management console, select the newly running instance and click connect.

  12. Once connected, the initial linux packages you will need to install are: git and python3. This can be done via:

    sudo yum install git python3

  13. Follow to instructions to SSH in to the instance and then install the package and setup the server via the Initial Setup and Setting Up A Server tutorials.
